text:
Q: moving from C, how to implement doubly linked list in C++ using the c++ features? A:

C-pointers work much better than smart pointers for a double-linked list. Smart pointers can have issues with stack overflow. Also, if the smart pointers were freed manually, there's no point to using smart pointers.

The destructor of the list class is responsible for freeing any resources held by the list. Smart pointers would just add much additional overhead, without bringing any benefits.

Q: Override default value in Hydra config by concatenation A:

The key path of output_dir here is paths.output_dir.
This is a textbook self reference.

paths:
  output_dir: ${paths.output_dir}/qad/${run_name}

Interpolations are evaluated lazily, on access.
What you are trying to do is to evaluate it somehow during config composition time.
This is not how it works.
You should probably create a new key for the default paths.

default_paths:
  data_dir: /path/to/data/nn_train_sets
  log_dir: /path/to/experiments
  output_dir: /path/to/experiments

and refer to it in your interpolation:

paths:
  output_dir: ${default_paths.output_dir}/qad/${run_name}

To help debug, you can print the config object to see what it looks like before you access. Remember that interpolation is evaluated on access.

Q: History on google A:

[Hint - before your post is closed]: Before google , there was yahoo! (so search "Key Reasons for Google's Dominance Over Yahoo")

Q: Find all deleted devices in Intune (MEM) A:

Find all deleted devices in Intune (MEM)

Users with the below permissions only has access to the Intune Audit Logs

  • Intune Service Administrator
  • Global Administrator
  • Administrators assigned to an Intune role with Audit data – Read permissions

Sign in to the Intune Portal

  • Select Tenant administration =>> Audit logs
